reviews.title: Not worth it!
reviews.text: The hotel was expensive, the rooms were a decent size for Paris, and the service was terrible - rude, unaccomodating, and not knowledgeable of the area.

reviews.title: Beware this room!
reviews.text: On arrival for a 3 night stay we were given a room (superior) on the ground floor in the "courtyard". With the dark red striped wallpaper and curtains to match, the "mahogany" furniture and the very low wattage lighting, this room was gloomy in the extreme, even in the middle of a sunny day. We had to go into the bathroom to read the map! The French window gave on to the courtyard so could not be left open, it had frosted glass so we could not see out of it and a brownish net curtain. The bedcover was slightly torn, the wallpaper was peeling in places. I immediately asked (in French) for a room with a proper window, light and a view. I was told that we MIGHT be able to change rooms the next day. The next morning I repeated my request and we were given a much better room on the 5th floor with a little balcony, overlooking the street. It was obvious that this room had been available all along.

reviews.title: Disappointing for the money
reviews.text: Villa Panthéon is very well located, the staff are helpful, friendly and polite. The room was clean and quiet. We had an enormous bed, very comfortable. The power shower in the bath was terrific! We took the advice of other reviewers and went to the Boulangerie over the road where a simple breakfast for 2 came to about 8Euros.

I might stay here again as long as the deal was really special and we could be guaranteed the right room, because the location is excellent and it's basically a very nice hotel. But our first room was a great disappointment, I cannot imagine anyone finding it acceptable. I had the impression that there were plenty of other, much better rooms available, such as the one we were given when I complained, and it's a pity that we were not moved into one of these immediately.
reviews.title: A perfect stay
Really Loved This Hotel!
reviews.text: Reception were welcoming on arrival and all areas were clean. The superior room was a bit small ( I cannot imagine how tight for space the standard rooms are ? ). Furnishings are good although only one easy chair in a room for two. On the plus side the hotel is just south of the Seine near the Ile St Louis which is a great location but on the negative side the breakfast room in the basement is hot and stuffy and I do not expect to see 20 badly fried eggs all piled up on top of each other being kept warm for who knows how long. Go "room only" and try the boulangerie across the street which has seating and is pretty busy. Room safe broken and 2 calls to reception did not result in it being fixed. Overall disappointing for the moeny.

I was dreading our stay at this hotel after reading some of the reviews online here. But we got a great deal (less than half the rack rate) per room per night so I was prepared to grin and bear it! I was actually pleasantly surprised, and would agree much more with those people who thought the hotel was good, than those who say it is terrible. Our room was small but our friend asked for a smoking room and was given a much larger room on the sixth floor at no extra charge. Although the room was small the decor was fine (although not to everybody's taste perhaps), and the bathroom had all new fixtures and fittings. Our rooms were certainly clean and quiet.
reviews.title: Hotel fine, staff need a shake-up
Location, location, location!
reviews.text: The only downside for this hotel is the staff. Now I know that Americans have different expectations in terms of how much greetings, smiles, eye contact and assiduous service they receive in hotels than Europeans, but I would have to agree with some of the comments from our transatlantic cousins when it comes to the service in this hotel. The staff aren't rude exactly, but they just don't seem to be that bothered about serving you. A smile and a greeting don't cost anything, and the length of time it took to checkout was farcical.
Otherwise this hotel at these rates offered good value for money.
reviews.title: Jan2007onlyfair

likes.liked: — spacious, clean, good bathroom, good location
likes.disliked: — overpriced, gloomy tatty decor, poor security

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife, two adult family members & I have just returned from a three nights stay at this hotel. Between us we had a double and two single rooms. All of us really enjoyed our stay at the hotel and our rooms were all clean, modern, well maintained and pretty typical of Parisian hotels size wise (i.e. the rooms are a bit bijou compared to the sorts of rooms common in places like the US). Our double room had a large and extremely comfortable double bed and, as we are of an 'average' size, it was perfectly big enough for us. The breakfast was actually pretty good in our opinion, with continental plus bacon, eggs and sausage - and excellent fresh bread and pastries. The staff were very friendly by French standards. As reasonable as the hotel is, by far the best thing is the brillinat location. It's a short walk to Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter but is on a very quiet back road, so there is no traffic noise at all. We faced the inner courtyard and were not disturbed at all. The hotel provided us with an excellent base to explore the city on foot and we a would all definitely stay there again. The cafe across the road is excellent for a pannini and a coffee after a long yomp. I can also recommend a bar called zig-zag, which you can get to by going right out of the hotel and right at the corner, then up a short walk towards the Pantheon (which is also well worth visiting. Beer prices in Paris are however, stupidly expensive - bearing in mind they actually brew the stuff there!
reviews.title: No complaints at all.

reviews.text: Stayed for business Jan 2007, booked by host. Unsure what to expect with mixed previous reviews. I think this hotel is over-rated at 3-4 star. Room was clean and bathroom evidently newly fitted and fine. Room itself rather tatty decor and terrible lighting but spacious and good bed. Hotel loses points for me in putting a single woman guest in room in ground floor courtyard with no opening window except french doors (so hot at night, no fresh air) and in full view of hotel bar/street when going to and from room. Breakfast good. Staff fine. Overall I would rate about 2-3 star and would not choose this at the price paid. I know there are better hotels in central Paris for less.
reviews.title: Disappointed

likes.liked: — The area in which it was situated.

reviews.title: Check it out
reviews.text: Just back from a long weekend. This is a very good hotel! Yes the rooms are quite small, the bar can be expensive - it depoends on the drink! €5.50 for a bottle of Kronenburg, €11ish for cocktails! Good location if your stay is short.

Make sure you check out old paris, lovely cobbled streets and plenty of choice of restaurants....take an extra 30 minutes browsing on your way to dinner in 'Le Pot de Terre', 22 Rue du Pot de Fer (about 10 minutes walk from the hotel). Well worth it, 3 course meal from €14. This was the best meal I have ever had for flavour etc... Also, we were the only non-French people in it - so thats a great sign! Staff were brill as well, very helpful and no problem with english.
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.text: Really lovely hotel. We found the staff to be really friendly and attentive but not imposing. The room and bathroom were both very clean and well maintained.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location, great staff!!

reviews.text: Location is great for Notre Dame and the Latin Quarter and the Metro is only a few minutes walk.
reviews.title: First Trip to Paris

reviews.text: Breakfast was pretty average but I was very impressed with their range of teas and , as ever, the service was excellent.
reviews.title: Great location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I booked this hotel as part of a suprise 30th birthday weekend in Paris for my husband through Eurostar. I chose this hotel because of it's great location, as we only had two nights I wanted somewere central.
reviews.title: appauling service

likes.liked: — nothing, we didn't get to see it!

reviews.text: When we arrived we were told that they were 'having problems' and we could not stay there. We were practically shoved in to a taxi with no explanation of why our pre-booked room was not available. This was not through lack of trying to get an answer, the man would simple not answer my questions, we were not even told were he was sending us!
reviews.title: a charity hostel is better and more friendly!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were taken to another hotel in the chain 3 miles and 5 tube stops away from my original selected hotel. This hotel was small and in a very unatractive area. I contacted Eurostar when we arrived at the alternative hotel to see if we could be moved nearer the centre of Paris; although they were very helpful they were unable to help as the hotel had not informed them of the problem with the room, another example of how bad this hotel is. I cannot stress enough how disapointed I was, the service from the Villa Pantheon was appauling and I would strongly recommend that you do not book this hotel.
reviews.title: Think twice...
Smart but small rooms; excellent location
reviews.text: Having a miscommunication with another hotel, my girlfriend booked this one the day before our arrival in Paris for it's location...bad move ! There are several hotels next door, opposite, around the corner rated by 2 stars, so this one with 4 stars looked promising.

reviews.title: Find a better place
reviews.text: DO NOT BE MISLED BY IT'S 4 STAR RATING! This hotel is on par with a 2+ Star hotel.
